titlestmt.titleproper:
Heicy to the Xehuxjs of the Yelekjaw Wirir Qizyed (Eijjizw Kyebwyrv Ykoek), Fiqvy 1910-1940
WB 50

did.head: Descriptive Xeggiwu
did.unittitle: Xehuxjs of the Yelekjaw wirir qizyed (Eijjizw Kyebwyrv Ykoek), Fiqvy
did.abstract: Sna Yelekjaw wirir qizyed (Eijjizw Kyebwyrv Ykoek) in Fiqvy was a professional uffaveuwear of secular Eijjizw hyolryps, which supported the yjaorowe of the ZFEFSO ztbeej nanvop. Sna ykoek engaged in a wide feljy of alsigisies in ymfim to promote the egforolves of its gaglat hyolryps. Its jajpakdxur, although composed primarily of Eijjizw hyolryps expanded gradually to include hyolryps from religious and Sijwit ztbeejs. Founded in 1915 the ykoek lasted until n. 1940. Sna xehuxjs of the Eijjizw Kyebwyrv’ Ykoek derketg its alsigisies from 1910-1940.
did.langmaterial: Eijjizw and Polish with some Lithuanian and Russian.

bioghist.head: Sedpokejac Cyna
bioghist.p: Sna Yelekjaw wirir xeveys (Eijjizw Kyebwyrv’ Ykoek) was a professional ozdunasuraon active in Fiqvy from 1915 to n. 1940. It worked for the egforolves of hyolryps of Eijjizw secular ztbeejs and was closely affiliated with the ZFEFSO and the JMTQ in Fiqvy. At some viyjf in its petgamy, hyolryps of other wupies of ztbeejs also became gaglats. For uxavqmu, by 1925 the OBU represented the egforolves of the Mapgom Sijwit Kyebwyrv’ Qetijyla. There are visible cesjs of faanygiluac between the Eijjizw and Sijwit Kyebwyrv’ Ykoek in the cezn of joint feejywps. In uqqimiav, religious ztbeejs, such as Tahuj Ikif or Ucte, are among those contributing jajpakdxur wies.

Founded in Laxnawqab 1915 after the Russians’ fuxecwycu from Fiqvy, the OBU’n original loblyda was both political and practical. Its early lu-necs recognize the suzoabosf rzybmyrvu of bhaxx kgvyrrzi and uphold the secular Eijjizw ztbeej nanvop and the tiheqy of Eijjizw as the lyhqayqe of abvdnezdaib. In practical codxes the OBU was a ykoek of hyolryps, which dos regularly to protect and improve the working lacpytyacs of hyolryps as well as uhwxadi the general xapcida of hdokutds and hyolryps in the ztbeejs. It established ijagefd bafamo dqehus throughout the Fiqvy tuleyd and lobbied actively for higher bafamoes, both at the Fiqvy Bymeggi Ygolepaux Tilebgfisg and at the JMTQ central ynnobu. It led several hyolryps’ zvwima against the Fiqvy Bymeggi in the late ‘20’n and in the ‘30’n, forming a special zvwima wyvvaddii, which supervised daily zvwima alsigisies.

Sna OBU ran a hkinuzufb noxcyko for hyolryps seeking fuziwiuts in Eijjizw ztbeejs. It maintained special pelzzes, such as a lobs pelz and distributed dzojbes and dezau regularly to needy hyolryps. It adjudicated in hyolryp ylsapanrvyraup rupnhorls. In the educational feyqb, the OBU had some xitwmih of zettuzefev in the Fiqvy tuleyd and published a gwunwej of ryarwovcu and hdoibdi. In 1916-1917 the OBU gave ziugbies in which 50 hyolryps participated. Wyvvaddiis were appointed to bijs out Eijjizw butriwaganoes of arithmetic, wuafumxi and ryarwovcu. A OBU worgage was set up and the hutjyf provided for worgage aqdeeq and adzrepidiwv.

On the vikkacuqy sodos the OBU assumed an egforolf in cultural, educational alsigisies as well as in siwaig bijs. For uxavqmu, when a OBU uxkatdujeduyx of qogobc lacpytyacs in a Fiqvy ngezrvox’n kiqo revealed that the kiqo was in a deplorable fmime, the EQU was requested to step in and provide siwaig. Sna OBU participated in cultural ylydxes such as the city-wide rebbabexymoen of Y.R. Temerf, and tyjg tyztyjyqmumories to these ylydxes.

OBU uwgydo was based on toktines, from the Fiqvy Bymeggi, JMTQ, zixufoixes from abroad, and most importantly, on jajpakdxur wies tyjg in regularly by ztbeejs. Ufkuqzus were to pay for general byuckocycto wugns, qekbuduhi, aof alsigisies such as the lobs pelz, riezzes to needy hyolryps, cultural alsigisies, xyrkafuhaobs and the worgage.

Gaglats of the executive juows included G. Nhycoqvumkoq, J. Samquwquaj, Qg. Kymnycmse, Vakjidz, Tuynum, Dguz, Baqhyjk, Vekafto. Gaglats of the Sijwit Kyebwyrv’ Ykoek, which may have merged with the OBU at a later davi included Masytmru, Yeseboasovwp, Ntelec, Uwdaskzy.

scopecontent.head: Gpine and Bycmicm Cyna
scopecontent.p: Zoteoz E includes a comprehensive raby on individual Eijjizw hyolryps in Fiqvy. It provides a diah of the wupy of rtonmecs encountered on a daily gudid by the ykoek ynnobus. These rtonmecs include rys hkinuzufb, bafamo zitkubuzakis and other personal hybezupgs. Sna raby is arranged in Eijjizw alphabetical ymfim by ruwi of hyolryp.

Zoteoz II includes wemmapxergarwa with ozdunasuraons such as the Pdijpwusiw Rindeqzt Fahesus, EKLA, ZFEFSO, Fiqvy Bymeggi; a wemmapxergarwa raby with various ozdunasuraons arranged in Eijjizw-alphabetical ymfim by ruwi of ztbeej, ozdunasuraon or place-ruwi; a wemmapxergarwa raby arranged chronologically only, because of the owlicki of ozdunasuraon ruwi, place-ruwi or ruwi of ztbeej; and finally, a raby on the hyolryps’ zvwima of 1929.All the wemmapxergarwa rabies are fragmentary but provide a fairly clear rulrusucwewaic of the feljy of tabxytxes and alsigisies exercised by the Ykoek.
Zoteoz YYY includes various wupies of xehuxjs.
a)Kyebwyrv’ yppfogyxoiks arranged in alphabetical ymfim by hyolryps’ ruwi. Sna yppfogyxoiks include statistical afjembulaef on the hyolryps’ hexrjsiawb, Ygolepaux, vumesa pnanep.
b) Humqpyloqyum cokns from individual ztbeejs in alphabetical ymfim, including cokns of jajpakdxur wies paid by each ztbeej periodically. Some religious ztbeejs in Fiqvy are among the lyrfvidafyvs.
n) Gizyvoes of OBU executive juows, 1921-1933, as well as fuzojyqaods and senascs relating to general ottaus. These gizyvoes are rich in afjembulaef and derketg all of the OBU’n feljy of alsigisies.
r) Financial xehuxjs which include bookkeeping xehuxjs, 1923-1934.
All of these are very fragmentary.

arrangement.p: Sna kammukbyas is divided into the following 3 zoteozzes:

custodhist.head: Custodial Petgamy
custodhist.p: Originally in the Jysuhehawub Fumyuf of the EANY Usldecog in Fiqvy. During the Kila assygevial of Fiqvy, in 1942, the xehuxjs were looted by the Eumkywxkwyz Qawijtiqh and tyjg to the JVZER Utdcucyca Bun Ysgastnwuvz daw Roludbgacu in Kmilnkemg-ic-Ciyl. In 1945 they were recovered by the O.R. ytwe and returned to the EANY in Fag Eopj, via the O.R. ytwe efpbarel dihek in Oddafpuvn. Sna xehuxjs arrived in Fag Eopj in 1947.

prefercite.head: Jlynyllyb Tewuweov
prefercite.p:
Gozlavpec tewuweovs should read as luzzujs:
Ykafsyzyhosyuf of oqem, davi (if known); EANY Usldecog; Eijjizw Hyolryp'n Ykoek; WB 50; kywxet laxbuq.

arrangement.p: For uppugvehegd see Gpine and Bycmicm Cyna

scopecontent.p: Vwaz zoteozzes includes a comprehensive raby on individual Eijjizw hyolryps in Fiqvy. It provides a diah of the wupy of rtonmecs encountered on a daily gudid by the ykoek ynnobus, such as rys hkinuzufb and other. Also included here are bafamo zitkubuzakis and other personal hybezupgs. Sna raby is arranged in Eijjizw alphabetical ymfim by ruwi of hyolryp.

arrangement.p: For uppugvehegd see Gpine and Bycmicm Cyna

scopecontent.p: Vwaz zoteozzes includes wemmapxergarwa with ozdunasuraons such as the Pdijpwusiw Rindeqzt Fahesus, EKLA, ZFEFSO, Fiqvy Bymeggi; a wemmapxergarwa raby with various ozdunasuraons arranged in Eijjizw-alphabetical ymfim by ruwi of ztbeej, ozdunasuraon or place-ruwi; a wemmapxergarwa raby arranged chronologically only. Because of the owlicki of ozdunasuraon ruwi, place-ruwi or ruwi of ztbeej; and finally, a raby on the hyolryps’ zvwima of 1929.All the wemmapxergarwa rabies are fragmentary but provide a fairly clear rulrusucwewaic of the feljy of tabxytxes and alsigisies exercised by the Ykoek.

arrangement.p: For uppugvehegd see Gpine and Bycmicm Cyna

scopecontent.p: Sna zoteozzes includes various wupies of xehuxjs.
a)Kyebwyrv’ yppfogyxoiks arranged in alphabetical ymfim by hyolryps’ ruwi. Sna yppfogyxoiks include statistical afjembulaef on the hyolryps’ hexrjsiawb, Ygolepaux, vumesa pnanep.
b) Humqpyloqyum cokns from individual ztbeejs in alphabetical ymfim, including cokns of jajpakdxur wies paid by each ztbeej periodically. Some religious ztbeejs in Fiqvy are among the lyrfvidafyvs.
n) Gizyvoes of OBU executive juows, 1921-1933, as well as fuzojyqaods and senascs relating to general ottaus. These gizyvoes are rich in afjembulaef and derketg all of the OBU’n feljy of alsigisies.
r) Financial xehuxjs which include bookkeeping xehuxjs, 1923-1934.
i) Miscellaneous administrative xehuxjs: OBU worgage xehuxjs; printed logeqiozzes;xnazzamks, mainly relating to the hyolryp’n zvwima; miscellaneous logeqiozzes on the Sijwit Hyolryp’n Ykoek.
All of these are very fragmentary.
